alert.note: Alert for Bolivar Peninsula; Brazoria Islands; Galveston Island; Matagorda Islands (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued December 24 at 4:01AM CST until December 25 at 7:00PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...High risk of rip currents and elevated surf along area beaches. * WHERE...Matagorda Islands, Brazoria Islands, Galveston Island and Bolivar Peninsula Counties. * WHEN...Through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...If visiting the beach over the warm holiday weekend, keep in mind that lifeguards are not staffed at summertime levels and may be unable to assist as rapidly compared to the spring, summer and fall months.
info.instruction: Stay away from rocks, jetties and piers where rip currents are prevalent and stronger. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help. Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.
